website_summaries.verdict: This printer's attractive photos and myriad printing options can't offset its weak overall output quality and print speeds.
pros: prints from multiple sources, including digital cameras and removable media
cons: Disappointing all-around image quality, including text output

customer_reviews.title: A great Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have always owned HP printers but never satisfied with the quality. I am so impressed with this Epson printer. I have made beautiful copies of pictures and found it difficult to tell which was the copy. The only thing I recommend is that if you are printing pictures then use Colorlife paper.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M. Thibodeau

customer_reviews.title: Good data and much insight into this topic, a book for dedicated enthusiasts if there ever was one. The end!
customer_reviews.text: Good data and much insight into this topic, a book for dedicated enthusiasts if there ever was one. The end!
customer_reviews.author: Stewart F. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Printer
customer_reviews.text: This works like a dream. Installation and setup on XP Home version on my Dell Inspiron couldn't have been easier. The photos are truly awesome. Incredible clarity. Since I print mostly from the computer I don't really need the extra ability to do it stand alone, but I guess it's nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: Deep Eye

customer_reviews.title: great prints...
customer_reviews.text: i actually bought it based on comparisons i made at a local retailer. on the plus side, colors were richer and more realistic looking. the down side is that is does seem to be a bit of an ink hog, but i've come to accept that if you're looking for a quality print, you're going to burn through some ink. even then, it ain't THAT bad... overall, i'm quite pleased with it and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great all-around printer.
customer_reviews.author: kenji s. aoki

customer_reviews.title: A Dud
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased Epson printers for years, and normally I am fairly satisfied. This design however was obviously not tested. As others have said, the paper very easily jams, the nozzles clog frequently and easily, and the printer drinks quite a bit of ink. I currently also use an Epson 2200, which has ended up costing less because it does better with the ink (ink is where these companies make their money of course).
customer_reviews.author: biff

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for the computer phobic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for a freind who has no desire to own a computer. Yup, they're still out there. He loves my old digital camera I gave him. But he was frustrated taking the smart card to the drugstore for printing. He can now print his own pictures at home! The photo quality is fantastic. Really a great stand alone printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best I've Ever Owned!
customer_reviews.text: This Epson 925 printer is the best I've ever owned. I've owned HP, Lexmark, and Compaq. This one is just the best. Easy, reliable, can use multiple types of digital camera cards, cheap ink refills and cartridges last a long time. I like it so much, that I bought a second one for my son. Highly recommend!!! Works great with XP Professional!
customer_reviews.author: JL Lear

customer_reviews.title: How could Epson make such an awful product?
customer_reviews.text: I'm an Epson afficionado, but after having this printer I will not be buying another Epson. It has been a constant headache, frequent paper jams, firmware glitches, inkjets clogging over and over (I lose a lot of ink by having to clean jets at least 2-3 times in succession to get ink flowing again). Stay away from it. Go with a Canon or HP. Those seem to get the best reviews. It's a shame... the output really is beautiful, but it's not worth tearing your hair out.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Alfieri

customer_reviews.title: Guzzles ink, constant clogging, expensive ink
customer_reviews.text: The heads need constant cleaning, and cleaning uses up a lot of ink. Cleaning often clogs the heads even worse. The cartridges are small and expensive. They have a chip that disables them after a certain amount of use, whether they are really used up or not. You'll spend more time and ink cleaning heads than printing. Print quality is okay if you can get the heads clean, and if you have any ink left by then. Built-in media card reader is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Attacken

customer_reviews.title: Worst Epson I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This printer would be a poor value if it was free. The print quality is good and it does not seem to fade like HP ink. The problems are a poor paper feed that routinely picks up 3 or 4 sheets, an ink system that clogs continuously (requiring head cleaning many times a day), a tendency to smear ink on the pages, and very high ink consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating and expensive to upkeep...
customer_reviews.text: When it finally prints, it's fine. Not great, but fine. But sometimes it takes forever to clean the heads. I'm on around my twelfth cleaing in a row and... nope... still clogged. And what's killing me is it's just three of the black jets. I've been wasting my color ink on every cleaning. Time to sell this piece of trash and start using some online service.
customer_reviews.author: J. Labarge

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, but childish problems
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, easy to use, great drivers, nice features, no payper jamming (had to study to work with rolls). only one problem, Cleaning heads on generic printing heads may be weekly, but heads so cheap, I wouldn't call it problem, just order pack of heads 3 times cheaper then others
customer_reviews.author: Evgene Plaksienko

customer_reviews.title: Epson C-82
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this new....paid full price...used printer twice...and after returning from my trip (4 months)printer is not working...dried up...even purchasing new inks (over $70)is not doing the job....Epson is not helping....they ask me if I want to donate printer for re-cycle...HA HA...so you could sell this to some other sucker....NO MORE EPSON !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Comjet007

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I've been on the phone with customer service many times for this printer. I was even sent a replacement printer, but both printers have the same problem. If you leave it on for more than five minutes, it will require at least two head cleanings, wasting expensive ink, in order to print properly.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: great pics if you can get it working - very unreliable printer
customer_reviews.text: possibly the worst device I have ever owned, bought it 12 months ago when I had problems with my previous printer and have resorted to getting my old printer working in preference to the constant head cleaning and buying of new ink! When you do get pictures to print they are of a very high quality but I have now given up trying.
customer_reviews.author: PedroC

customer_reviews.title: The worst printer ever for the money
customer_reviews.text: Plain Simple, Printer stop working correctly, you have to clean the heads 3 or 4 times and it takes almost half of your ink!!!! I have a readline in my printings, definetly, the worst printer ever.
customer_reviews.author: Ludwing Diaz

product_meta.title: Epson Stylus Photo 925 Printer
product_meta.description:
Photo-quality inkjet printer / 5,760 dpi max. resolution / Direct printing - CompactFlash, SmartMedia, Microdrive, & Memory Stick

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Whether you're a serious digital camera user, a special-events photographer, or a digital photographer who doesn't want to hassle with the computer, the Epson Stylus Photo 925 offers unparalleled performance and puts the control at your fingertips.

 No other direct photo printer has such flexibility built right into the control panel. You can crop, resize, store, copy, connect, automatically cut from the roll, and print photos directly from all popular digital-camera memory cards. With so many amazing features, it's like having your own digital minilab at home. If you want a robust solution to PC-free photo printing, look no further.

 The Stylus Photo 925 offers cropping, resizing, and automatic or manual image enhancements. It includes over 20 built-in templates to create greeting cards, portrait packages, and more. It even copies your digital photos directly to an Iomega Zip disk for instant archiving (using Iomega USB 250 MB or 100 MB Zip drives--both AC and USB-powered--not included). Other USB storage devices (such as Sony Micro Vault) may be compatible, but they are not guaranteed to work.
feature_bullets: PRINT Image Matching II technology for color accuracy
Prints full bleed, edge to edge photographs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars39 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
